Articles.Content:
1. Is it possible?

2. How can I do it on a Mac?

I heard someone say it's just alt > or alt + clicking on the warp, but neither of those work for me...
Hold alt and click the . button. That should work, even on a Mac.

On the windows version, you can force P-warp by pressing Alt in addition to the normal commands (which is very useful at low altitudes over moons that have no atmosphere).

On a Mac, I can't really help you, but you should try some key combinations (maybe Command, maybe something else).

E: Ninja'd

Just in case, try Command+> as well, if Alt/Option key doesn't work.

O.o

Double ninja'd.
Oh, maybe I was just hitting the wrong button. Thanks for the help Dalfite, Cykrios
